availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Vernon K. Stevenson (Nashville, Davidson County, TN, railroad owner and Quartermaster General (C.S.A.))

body.p: Nashville, Tennessee, clerk, railroad owner and soldier. Kentucky native. Married to Elizabeth Childers Stevenson in Davidson County, Tennessee, on June 28, 1834. Father of Matilda Stevenson and Vernon Stevenson. Married M. S. Bass Stevenson in Davidson County on November 1, 1854. Married Anna L. Eve Stevenson in Davidson County on December 9, 1861. Clerk in Nashville c1828. Founded Nashville & Chattanooga Railroad in 1848. Merchant in Nashville in 1850. Railroad owner in Nashville in 1860. Served as Quartermaster General of the Western Military Department (C.S.A.) until an injury at the Battle of Shiloh in April 1862.
